section1.title: What are InvisiClues?
content: The essence of all interactive fiction is solving problems. The purpose of InvisiClues hint booklets is to maximize your enjoyment of the story by giving you only those hints that you need to continue and complete the story.

The invisible hints generally progress from a gentle nudge in the right direction to a full answer. The questions, which naturally have to be visible, have been worded to give away as little as possible. You should not use the presence or absence of a question on a certain topic as an indication of importance, and you should not assume that long answers are associated with important questions. This booklet includes dummy questions and answers in order to minimize this problem.

section2.title: How to use this booklet
content: If you are stuck at some point in ZORK II, find the question that most pertains to your problem. Uncap the marker and run it once over the first hint. The writing will appear within a second or two. If you are still stumped, go on to the next hint. (Remember to recap the marker when you are done to prevent it from drying out. And by the way, these books are not immortal. InvisiClues you've developed will start to fade after six months.)
Your marker contains more than enough fluid to develop the entire booklet. However, if your marker gets lost or dried out, you can order a replacement marker for a nominal fee.

You can use the listing of how all the points are scored as a last resort. Once you have finished ZORK II, try the things in the "For Your Amusement" section. Don't look at them before you've finished, though â they may reveal the answers to certain problems.

questions.title: How do you get down off a dragon?
answers: You can't. You get down off a goose.
You can't. Relax and enjoy the ride.

questions.title: What is the solution to the riddle?
answers: The word "tall" is somewhat misleading from the usual point of view.
Something deep, from the bottom, appears tall.
It is a well. Type:  ANSWER "A WELL".  The key words are "round", "tall", and "draw".

questions.title: Is it possible to leave the carousel heading west?
answers: Not until the carousel has been stopped.

questions.title: I'm getting tired of the carousel; can it be stopped?
answers: Yes.  The ZORK implementors do have some compassion.
When you reach the point where a solution is possible, it should be fairly obvious.
It involves the buttons in the Machine Room.

questions.title: How can I map the area around the Carousel Room?
answers: If you give a direction to leave the carousel (such as WALK SOUTH), there is a 31% chance that you will actually go that way (low, but certainly better than random).
Once you've left the carousel, find the direction back to it.

questions.title: What do I do with the clay brick?
answers: Be careful with it.
Burning it will make its use apparent.
It's plastic explosive.
Using a fuse may give you time to leave the area before it explodes.
Try inserting the black string.

questions.title: How do I open the door in the Tiny Room?
answers: Have you looked through the window?
Are the spheres useful for anything?
Have you looked into the red sphere?
The door is locked from the inside.  The key is still in the lock.
You can push the key out of the hole with the letter opener.
Try the old trick of slipping something under the door to catch the key.
Try using the place mat.

questions.title: Is there a way to get past the ice in the Ice Room?
answers: Yes.
Have you tried melting the glacier with anything?
A large, portable source of heat might be useful.
There is one nearby.
You can lure the dragon into the Ice Room, thus solving two puzzles.
Have you noticed that if you attack or in some way annoy the dragon, then leave the room, he follows you?

questions.title: Where do I find an Ice Pick?
answers: There is none.

questions.title: What is going on in the Topiary?
answers: You're not going to let a few hedges scare you, are you?

questions.title: How do I catch the unicorn and get the golden key?
answers: "The unicorn is a mythical beast."
Only one of royal blood may approach a unicorn.
Rescue the Princess from the dragon and watch what she does.
Follow her.

questions.title: How do I enter the gazebo?
answers: You will not enter the dragon's lair while he lives.

questions.title: How do I kill the dragon?
answers: You are too puny to harm him directly.
Even bombs have no effect!
Did you notice when you attack the dragon and leave, he follows you?
You can use this technique to lure him to the Ice Room.

questions.title: Can I kiss the Princess?
answers: Only when she's sleeping.  Don't try anything nasty.

questions.title: How do I open the door in the Guarded Room?
answers: You will need a key to unlock it.
You have probably seen the key.
It is hanging from a red ribbon around the neck of the unicorn.
You will also need to do something about the lizard doorkeeper.

questions.title: What do I do about the lizard doorkeeper?
answers: It cannot be killed.
It can be satisfied by a particular treasure.  When you find it, it should be obvious.
There is a box of rare candied insects at the bottom of a pool of water.

questions.title: How do I move the menhir?
answers: Blasting will have no effect on it.
You will not be able to get past the large menhir until you have mastered the Wizard's power, which first requires solving most of the other puzzles in the game.
One way to move it is to use the wand to "float" it.
Another way is to ask the demon to move it for you.

questions.title: What do I do with the Grue Repellent?
answers: Read the label.

questions.title: Does the club have any use?
answers: Examine it.
It is a baseball bat.
It is a clue to the nature of this maze.

questions.title: How do I reignite the club?
answers: If you examine it, you'll notice that it was never ignited.

questions.title: What do the glowing diamonds signify?
answers: Progress.  The brighter they glow, the closer you are to solving the puzzle.

questions.title: How do I break the glassy substance?
answers: It cannot be done with the club.
You might try the bomb, but it won't get you anywhere.
The solution to the problem of the Oddly Angled Room has nothing to do with breaking walls.

questions.title: What is the signifigance of the convention of wizards?
answers: You've been fantasizing again.

questions.title: Why does my sword glow when I am at the bottom of the stairs?
answers: You are one room away from a dangerous creature.

questions.title: What in the world do I do in the Oddly Angled Room?
answers: If you solve this without any help at all, my cap is off to you!
The maze was meant to confound maze mappers.

There are nine rooms.  Almost all of the room connections are probabilistic â sometimes they work and sometimes they don't. (If you repeat any direction often enough, you'll travel through all the rooms.)
Have you noticed all of the baseball clues:  the Babe Flathead bat, "You'll never get past first base at this rate..."?
The glowing diamonds are baseball bases â the brighter they glow, the further you've progressed.
Left-handed pitchers are sometimes called "southpaws."

The solution is to walk in the directions of a standard baseball diamond, starting from home plate (where the bat is):  southeast, northeast, northwest, southwest.  (It is admittedly a very difficult puzzle â apologies to non-American Zorkers).

questions.title: What is the curtain of light for?
answers: Have you read the bank brochure?
Have you tried touching it?
Have you tried throwing anything at it?
Have you tried walking through it?

questions.title: How do I turn off the alarm system?
answers: Are there any switches or electrical devices in the area?
Does the Wizard have any appropriate spells?
Unfortunately, the alarm system remains foolproof.  You must find another way to remove treasures.

questions.title: How do I get out of the Small Room?
answers: You came in through a door, didn't you?
Like most doors, the curtain door has two sides.
The other side of the door may not be apparent.
Try walking through the south wall.
Once the curtain door has closed, the only way out is to give the Gnome something valuable.  If you have nothing of value, you will be trapped forever.

questions.title: How does carrying the portrait affect where I will end up?
answers: Any association between items you are carrying and the room to which the curtain door leads is purely coincidental.

questions.title: How many places can I get to from the Depository?
answers: Seven, inlcuding four through the curtain.

questions.title: How do I get into the vault?
answers: The curtain door leads to four locations.
It is completely deterministic (i.e., non-random).
The location to which it leads is determined by the direction from which you entered the Depository.

If you enter from the east, you will be transported to the East Viewing Room; if you enter from the west, to the West Viewing Room.  If you enter from the south (e.g., the Chairman's Office) you will be transported to the Small Room.
You can leave the Small Room by walking through the south wall (thus entering the Depository from the North).
If you enter the Depository from the north, you will be transported to the Vault.

questions.title: How do I get out of the Vault?
answers: How did you get out of the Small Room?
Try the north wall.

questions.title: What are the basket and canvas for?
answers: The canvas is attached to the basket, as is the receptacle.
You can get into the basket.
This is a deflated balloon.

questions.title: Once I've determined what the basket and canvas are, how do I use them?
answers: Once you inflate the balloon, you will find a card with instructions for use.  These hints deal with inflation.
Not all balloons use hydrogen or helium.
Remember that hot air is less dense and therefore rises?
Burn something (such as the newspaper) in the receptacle.

questions.title: How do I leave the top of the volcano without being killed?
answers: You don't but isn't it a glorious death?

questions.title: Which of the three paths down to the valley is best?
answers: Ask the scarecrow.
Beware of the lions and tigers and bears.
I suppose you'll soon be skipping and singing, "We're off to see the Wizard".
If you haven't guessed by now, this is a nonsense question.

questions.title: What is the signifigance of the mines and smelter?
answers: Have you tried processing ore?
Did you dig for the lode of mithril?

I find it amazing that you got this far, since there are no mines or smelters in Zork II.  Keep in mind the warning in the introduction: Do not use the presence or absence of a question on a certain topic as an indication of what is important, and don't assume that long answers indicate important questions.

questions.title: How do I extend the lava tube?
answers: This is not possible.

questions.title: What do I do about the gnome?
answers: The volcano gnome appears only if you are stranded on a ledge.  He will help you, but only for a fee.

questions.title: How can I translate the books?
answers: A Zorkish-to-English dictionary would be useful, wouldn't it?
So, of course, there isn't one.
You cannot translate them.

questions.title: How can I open or remove the rusty old box?
answers: It has an oblong hole chipped into it.
Nothing short of blasting will open it.  Someone seems to have done you a favor by creating a hole in which to place the bomb.

questions.title: Who is M. Agrippa?
answers: Didn't he design the Pantheon in Rome?

questions.title: Can I get up the well, and if so, how?
answers: Yes. What is a well for?
Have you tried putting water in the bucket?
Get in the bucket, then pour water in it.

questions.title: What does the engraving say?
answers: It is the logo for a Frobozzco subsidiary.

obo
obo
r
z
AGI
becomes
f
MAGIC
z
 
EL
c
WELL
Y
o
n
mpa
mpa

or "Frobozz Magic Well Company" as can be clearly read at the top of the well.

questions.title: How do I catch the magic mouse?
answers: Have you tried using the green cheese?
There is no mouse.  Sorry.

questions.title: Can the writing on the cakes be read?
answers: On all but one, it is too small to see with the naked eye.
Not even the robot can read it.
A magnifying glass would be useful.
Try reading it through the flask in the Pool Room.

questions.title: Can the Mad Hatter be cured?
answers: There is no cure for advanced mercury poisoning?
What Mad Hatter?

questions.title: How do I get back down from here?
answers: The reverse of the way you got up.
If the bucket has gone back down, you're stuck.  The water evaporates in 100 moves.

questions.title: What do the cakes do?
answers: Experiment with them.  Try eating them.  You can't be afraid to try anything in Zork II (but you may want to SAVE your state first).
Reading them will tell you something.

questions.title: What can I do with the flask of poison?
answers: Kill yourself or others.
Examine it.
Examine it.  Look through it.  Use it as a magnifier to read the writing on the cakes.

questions.title: How can I get the object under the water?
answers: You cannot successfully enter the water.
There is no valve to drain the pool or plug the leak.
There is a way to make the pool evaporate.
Try throwing the red ("evaporate") cake into the pool.

questions.title: How do I cross the chasm?
answers: There is no way to cross while in your small state.
Once you return to normal size, the chasm will be a small crack again.

questions.title: How do I control the robot?
answers: Read the instructions.

questions.title: What is EBCDIC?
answers: It stands for Extended Binary-Coded-Decimal Interchange Code, which IBM equipment often uses instead of ASCII (American Standard Code for Information Exchange).

questions.title: What is a footpad?
answers: It is not a doormat.
Check the dictionary.
It means "thief" (i.e. you).

questions.title: How can I take the red sphere?
answers: Have you noticed that when the cage falls, you don't die immediately?
You have time to tell the robot to lift the cage (if he is in the room).

questions.title: What do the buttons do?
answers: If you push them, you are electrocuted.
You can experiment with them by ordering the robot to push them.
The buttons control the electromagnetic field which spins the Carousel Room.

The square button increases the spin to high speed.  The round button decreases the spin to low speed.  The triangular button flips the field from the Carousel Room to the Low Room, releasing the iron box and causing the carousel to stop spinning.  (Note:  increasing the speed and flipping the field up to the Low Room is dangerous.

questions.title: Can I open the Wizard's trophy case?
answers: Not directly.
Treasures you were carrying when you died or which the Wizard has "filched" from you are kept in his trophy case.  If you acquire the Wizard's wand, you can "filch" them back.

questions.title: How do I take the Wizard's wands from the wand rack?
answers: You don't. They can't be taken.

questions.title: What do I do with the yellow sphere?
answers: You've been fantasizing again.
There is no yellow sphere.

questions.title: How can the owl be released?
answers: The owl and the other memoriabilia in the Trophy Room are protected by a powerful spell which cannot be broken.
No kidding!

questions.title: What do I do with the black sphere?
answers: Have you tried looking into it?
The creature with the horrible face has freed you to return to your quest after dying.  Can you return the favor?
It has been alleged that dmeons are conjured up using pentagrams.
Try placing the black sphere in the pentagram.

questions.title: Can the flying owl be caught?
answers: Don't you have your owl net handy?
The FANTASIZE spell does not include a flying owl.  Where did you see it?

If every question in this book were pertinent to the game, the questions themselves would give far too much away.  Questions such as this should convince you to ignore questions that are not of immediate use.

questions.title: How do I detach the stands from the bench?
answers: You don't.

questions.title: What are the stands for?
answers: Their colors should be revealing.
Rubies are red, sapphires are blue, diamonds are clear.
Try putting the crystal spheres in the appropriate stands.

questions.title: Does the pentagram have any signifigance?
answers: It has been alleged that pentagrams are used by wizards to conjure up demons.

questions.title: What do I do with the palm tree?
answers: Admire its beauty.

questions.title: How do I kill the serpent?
answers: A fish out of water...
Have you tried breaking the aquarium glass?
As serpents are rather dangerous, you should stand far back and throw something at the glass.

questions.title: How do I enter the aquarium?
answers: You might try typing:  ENTER THE AQUARIUM
There is no way to enter the aquarium and live.

questions.title: How do I satisfy the demon?
answers: Have you tried following his instructions?
If you have been wondering what to do with all the treasures, you now know.

You must give him the fancy violin, moby ruby, zorkmid coin, Flathead stamp, zorkmid bills, portrait, golden statuette, pearl necklace, gaudy crown, and golden key (minus any you had in your possession when you died or any that were "Filched" from you).

questions.title: What do I do once I've satisfied the demon?
answers: You should as the demon to give you something.
It's something you need to finish the game; you've seen it but haven't been able to get it.
It's the wizard's wand.  Type:  DEMON, GIVE ME THE WAND, or DEMON, KILL THE WIZARD.

questions.title: What is the object of this game?
answers: Part of the object of this game is to discover the object of this game.
If you just keep solving puzzles, eventually you will find that you have finished the game.

questions.title: What should I do with the treasures I've found?
answers: This is one of the puzzles you must solve.  It really doesn't matter where you keep them.  You will find out what to do with them later in the game.

questions.title: What do I do about the Wizard?
answers: You need to discover and master the source of the Wizard's powers in order to complete the game.  Until you do, he will create a lot of mischief for you.

questions.title: How many spells are there in this game?
answers: There are 12 that the Wizard commonly casts on you.
There are seven others that have special purposes.
The 12 are FALL, FLOAT, FREEZE, FENCE, FIERCE, FERMENT, FEAR, FEEBLE, FUMBLE, FILCH, FANTASIZE, AND FIREPROOF.  The seven are FRY, FUDGE, FLOURESCE, FREE, FROBIZZ, FROBOZLE, and FROBNOID.

questions.title: What does the FANTASIZE spell do?
answers: Sometimes it causes you to see a bizarre object that isn't there in the room.

questions.title: How do I cast a spell?
answers: You'll need a wand.
Read the white book.
Point (or wave) the wand at the object to be ensorcelled.  Then incant the spell (e.g. SAY "FLOAT")

questions.title: Is there anything special about the spells the Wizard mumbles?
answers: No.  They are the same ones he says aloud.

questions.title: Where should I play the violin?
answers: Carnegie Hall?
Where is HELLO SAILOR useful?

questions.title: How can I get the pearls back from the housekeeper?
answers: What housekeeper?
Are you sure that you are playing Zork II?

questions.title: How do I get past Cerberus?
answers: The FIERCE spell is not recommended.
The FLOAT and FEEBLE spells are not strong enough.
Even the demon can't overcome him (them?).
Try taming him by putting on his collar.
The collar is found behind the menhir.

questions.title: Where does saying HELLO AVIATOR cause something to happen?
answers: The same place HELLO SAILOR and HELLO FOOTPAD cause something to happen.
Nowhere.

questions.title: What do I do for light when my lamp runs out?
answers: If you have oer 200 points and are in the dark with a burned-out lamp, wait for the Wizard to arrive.  He will cast the FLOURESCE spell and you won't need a light source (however, there are unfortunate side effects).

questions.title: Can the dmeon help me?
answers: He is mightier than the Wizard.
He will help you if you help him.
Once you have satisfied him, he will perform a deed for you.
Ask him to give you the wand or to move the menhir.

questions.title: Where do I find the white sphere?
answers: Try looking into the blue sphere?
It is actually clear, not white.

For any man with half an eye
What stands before him he may spy
But optics sharp it needs and keen
To see what is not to be seen
â "Sleuth"
Clear glass is invisible under water.
It is in the aquarium.

questions.title: Are the spheres useful for anything?
answers: What if they were called crystal balls?
Have you tried examining them?
Try looking through them.
When you look into one, you see the view from the next one in the chain (somewhat like the palantirs in The Lord of the Rings).

questions.title: How many spheres are there?
answers: Have you ever died in ZORK II?
There are four.
You will create the fourth with the first three.

questions.title: What do I do with the perfect rose?
answers: Admire it's beauty.
Must something so beautiful have any other use?

questions.title: How do I go down the staircase landing without being killed?
answers: In later releases (revision) of the game, the landing is guarded by "magical" runes.
"Magical wardens," "green lines of enormous power," "close in on you as if searching for something.
You may proceed down the stairs and to the finish if you are carrying the Wizard's wand.

questions.title: What do I do with the heads on poles?
answers: We suggest that you not disturb the remains.
Let the dead rest in peace.

questions.title: What is the signifigance of "Feel Free"?
answers: Both words begin with an "F".
This is an inside joke.  It is what one Implementor says to another Implementor offering suggestions for changes in a game.  It has no signifigance.

questions.title: I have all the points but somehow don't feel finished. What do I do?
answers: Type:  SCORE
The grue repellent label is a very subtle hint.
The Crypt is a "place of death."
It is too light to see the door to ZORK III.
When the crypt is dark, the door is visible.  (Of course, the crypt will never be dark if you are flourescing.)  In release 18 and later, you will need to be carrying the wand also.

questions.title: I've finished the game but don't have all 400 points. What's going on?
answers: Don't let it bother you.  You have really completed the game.
Treasures in the Wizard's trophy case are not required to satisfy the demon.  Each treasure not give to the demon will leave you with fewer points.

questions.title: I haven't finished the game and I don't have all 400 points.
answers: So what else is new?
pearl necklace
in the Pearl Room
gold key
hanging on the unicorn
dragon statuette
in the chest
red sphere
in the Dingy Closet
fancy violin
in the iron box
portrait
in the Bank Chairman's office
moby ruby
in the Lava Room
zorkmid bills
in the Bank Vault
blue sphere
in the Dreary Room
package of candy
under the pool of tears
black sphere
you create it
gaudy crown
in the rusty box
clear sphere
in the aquarium
Flathead Stamp
in the purple book
gigantic dog collar
in the Kennel
gold zorkmid coin
on the narrow volcano ledge
Wizard's wand
the Wizard has it

questions.title: Other Points
answers:
Other points are gained by:
...solving the riddle (5)
...getting to the top of the well (10)
...killing the dragon (5)
...entering the Wizard's Workshop (10)
...solving the Oddly Angled Room maze (5)
...entering Cerberus' room (10)
...entering the Crypt anteroom (3)
...entering the Crypt (2)
...giving treasures to the demon (2 each, maximum 20).

questions.title: Have you ever tried...
answers: ...setting off the bomb in the Dusty Room and then waiting in the balloon tied to the ledge?
...petting or killing Cerberus after putting on his collar?
...removing Cerberus' collar?
...attacking the Princess?
...taking the serpent?
...diagnosing yourself while under certain spells?
...waiting around the Topiary?
